thread.title: Kardashian-Jenners Say They Will Stop Publishing on Their Apps While They Pray For Lamar Odom
thread.title_full: Kardashian-Jenners Say They Will Stop Publishing on Their Apps While They Pray For Lamar Odom

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: Kardashian-Jenners Say They Will Stop Publishing on Their Apps While They Pray For Lamar Odom
text:
Share Tweet Pin E-mail Getty Michael Tran/FilmMagic On Thursday, members of the Kardashian-Jenner family made their first joint public statement about Lamar Odom's hospitalization. Kendall and Kylie Jenner and Kim and Khloé Kardashian posted a same message to their respective websites, telling fans they would cease publishing all content to the apps while Lamar remains in the hospital.
Share Tweet Pin E-mail Khloe Kardashian More From Cosmopolitan "As a family, we've decided to hold off on publishing content across our apps while we continue to support and pray for Lamar," the statement reads. "Thank you for your kindness and understanding during this difficult time." ​ The four sisters launched their apps back in September (Kourtney Kardashian's won't be released until next year.)
Khloé remains by Lamar's bedside as reports swirl that, while technically still married to the comatose athelete, she may be the one responsible for his medical decisions . After cancelling her baby shower to stay with her sister, E! News reports Kim has returned to Los Angeles for a pregnancy-related doctor's appointment. She was joined by Kourtney, Kylie and their mother Kris Jenner who returned to California with her.
Share Tweet Pin E-mail Harry How / Getty Images Lamar remains unresponsive and unable to breath without the assistance of a machine after being found unresponsive during a four-day stay at a brothel in Nevada . Witnesses told police Lamar took cocaine while he was there; doctors reportedly believe Lamar suffered from a drug overdose .
